intro: Leiothrix araxaensis, commonly known as the Araxa flameflower, is a striking member of the Melastomataceae family native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red and orange flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its botanical features include showy bracts that resemble petals, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
